Posts.Content: Eeyore rides in my car too! and yes, they can wave, just watch the next one you see very closely, you will understand.. thanks for noticing me! =^..^=
Posts.Title: Postponed again - oh well...

Posts.Content: I know this is a horrible disease, and it takes many peoples lives. but a positive attitude and your faith in God (or whatever you may believe in), is the only thing you should be concentrating on. Farrah is someone who has been in our lives through television etc for many many years, so it seems as if it is someone you know and are close to. It does make it harder, and I'm sure it affects everyone harder than they think it will. Do not give up. If you are depressed, talking it out helps, we are all here for you. If we can't help, go to a professional. Please don't let it get so far that it affects your health. We all care about you too much, and it would hurt all of us too. Be well and happy. Cat
Posts.Title: Farah Fawcett

Posts.Content: I usually avoid those types of programs, I helped my mother in law die at home with colon cancer, and it was two weeks I would never replace but never want to relive through anyones eyes. It is sad, depressing, and it hits too close to home, so I have avoided it. I have heard some things about her on the news, but I don't think I will visit the program. How was your Palms Springs vacation? hot? =^..^=
Posts.Title: Farah Fawcett

Posts.Content: Susan, you always know what to say to encourage someone. That is so special. Very nice. =^..^=

Posts.Content: you are on tonite girl!!! =^..^=

Posts.Title: Posting Pix and Tutorials, etc etc

Posts.Content: and any surgery is something you will worry about. I never talked about my issues with my reconstruction surgery, figuring this one I brought on myself, but I kept getting told (Susan) that it is not my fault and to stop beating myself up about it. It all matters. So, be anxious, but also know that you will have a whole group of people in there with you during your surgery and all of the prayers and good thoughts that come with us. Let us know how it goes. Cat
Posts.Title: surgery next wednesday

Posts.Content: but to hear them tell it I was spoiled rotten and got everything I wanted....ha ha. And yes, you and Susan have always been there for me, and everyone here, and it is seriously appreciated! Cat
Posts.Title: surgery next wednesday

Posts.Content: no node involvement, better than you expected, but just what you deserve. Sounds like all is going great. Thanks for the update =^..^=
Posts.Title: Surgeon Just Called With News!!!!

Posts.Content: there is a website that the family set up for information, check it out from 5/14 - haven't heard anything lately on her but will post when I hear more It is disturbing isn't it? =^..^=
Posts.Title: 10 year old girl with cancer

Posts.Content: we are so close together I didn't realize. I was diagnosed Feb 19, 2007 and had my surgery March 22, 2007. I had a great party to go to in Chen's neck of the woods on 3/22 last year, have no idea what, if anything, we will do for the next one. Yours sounds great, and I know you will have a wonderful time. =^..^=
Posts.Title: Surprise Plans for my upcoming cancerversary

Posts.Content: I thought through surgery (they were taking stuff away), that I would lose weight. no. I figured chemo would do the trick, nauseau, food smelling and tasting bad...no. I had my sweet hubby constantly feeding me, saying I need to keep up my strength, and he cooks all the really good fattening foods, and I have gained 10 lbs. So I need to go back to eating right, and exercising. I have a friend who walks my neighborhood with me, and since all our streets are on hills, we get a good workout. So I have my (yes I am saying it again) final surgery Friday, and then I am going back to eating right and doing more walking. Good luck in yours, and if we can be weight loss buddies, it may help! Cat
Posts.Title: I need to lose weight and need a support group

Posts.Content: don't stop, we love them and obviously you do too! Keep 'em coming =^..^=
Posts.Title: OK LAST ONES FOR AWHILE I PROMISE!

Posts.Content: I've posted a couple of pictures, they show just a small slice of how many people were there. No official count has been published, but I keep hearing 45 or 50 thousand. Imagine that. Thank you all again for your support on this, my very first walk! Cat
Posts.Title: *******THANK YOU CATS TOY!*******

Posts.Content: I got my card too Chen! and it was the first of the season for me. I usually get the jewelers card first....hmm. Very sweet, and of course I noticed the "address" label, too cute! thanks again for starting the ornament exchange. Cat
Posts.Title: Chen~You Cheated!!

Posts.Content: All of you who do the walks, send your prayers, good vibes, good wishes, you do it for all of us. There is such a sense of unity on these boards, you make my heart happy. Cat
Posts.Title: *******THANK YOU CATS TOY!*******

Posts.Content: good vibrations being sent your way! Cat
Posts.Title: Ultrasound tomorrow

Posts.Content: She is already blessed to have a friend like you. Absolutely, prayers going her way. Please keep us up to date. I don't log in here as much, the site doesn't let me most days, but I always have everyone here in my prayers. Cat
Posts.Title: Regarding Irishwhispers

Posts.Content: My needle biopsy was on a friday afternoon and I had the results by monday afternoon (even though it was a holiday). So you shouldn't have to wait too long. I will be thinking of you Monday at 10am, I will also be at the doc, my GP, to get blood, ekg and x-ray for surgery, which they have now pushed up to the 13th!. So, have a relaxing, fun filled weekend, and worry about tomorrow the day after. =^..^=
Posts.Title: Not wasting any time that

Posts.Content: pity or otherwise, do what you need to do, and let it out. Venting stops you from letting it build up inside and that would be a bad thing. Sorry that your family isn't there for you, but don't let it eat at you. We are here for you, hope you start feeling better soon. =^..^=
Posts.Title: Pity Party

Posts.Content: sometimes they just don't know what to say, so the easiest thing is to say nothing. I am sticking with that one. My brother lives in Vegas and I never heard from him by phone or email through my diagnosis, surgery and first chemo. First time we spoke, my mom handed me the phone when he called her. He never asked how I was doing, just ran off a list of things I should and should not avoid foodwise so as not to "catch" it again. I then told him I always ate healthy, we do not eat fast food, we always buy fresh organic vegetables with no bug spray, farm fresh eggs, etc. and guess what? I got cancer!!! gee, what do I do now? He couldn't really say anything then but "oh". Can't let them drag us down. We need to keep only the positive and happy people around us, and if that means avoiding some family and friends, so be it. We will get through it without them if need be. =^..^=
Posts.Title: Pity Party

Posts.Content: the wonderful So Cal rain! You are in Riverside county right? I was falling asleep to it around 3am! It's wonderful! I know others get too much of it, but we need more. Isn't it perfect weather for recouperating? =^..^=
Posts.Title: There's this funny stuff falling from the sky!!! Is the sky falling??????

Posts.Content: Susie, you can find me on facebook: Vicki Hilton but I posted most here now, so if you want, check my expressions page again thanks! Cat
Posts.Title: Thanks RE, Cats Toy & Bella Luna for the photos of the CSN REunion!

Posts.Content: But yes, that usually is the norm, the scar tissue from the lumpectomy makes shadows on the mammo, so they need more tests just to verify. Take a deep breath or two and ask for your ultrasound as soon as possible. that will help ease your mind. Let us know how it goes. Cat
Posts.Title: I'm scared

Posts.Content: and thanks for finding me on Facebook, it reminded me to come back here and post more of the pictures! I have most on now if anyone wants to look at them. It was such a fun day, I actually posted on facebook, it was just like a real reunion, no awkwardness, no hesitancy, just lots of hugs, laughing, talking, etc. We (almost) made more noise than the boats in the harbor! Cat

Posts.Title: Thanks RE, Cats Toy & Bella Luna for the photos of the CSN REunion!

Posts.Content: you don't have to provide that information, and we just found out recently that it was accessible to anyone, so we removed it. There are lots of privacy settings you can use to keep yourself safe, I actually have a friend who has all of the privacy settings on, so that I can't even see her. She does it for safety issues because some people object to her lifestyle and she considers it an unfortunate necessity. So when I need to contact her, it is by email. go figure. And yes, I went to work today just waiting for someone to ask about my weekend, no one did, so I had to tell them anyway...haha and you're welcome again Lex! Cat
Posts.Title: Thanks RE, Cats Toy & Bella Luna for the photos of the CSN REunion!

Posts.Title: Thanks RE, Cats Toy & Bella Luna for the photos of the CSN REunion!

Posts.Content: I am butting in on this one, I LOVE garage sales, especially if they have plants. I usually go to the clearance aisle to get the ones half dead, then I am so happy when I can bring them back to life. I have been buying bunches of plants, but they have been piling up on my front porch waiting for me to put them in the yard! the bench sounds great too! I have a mini one in my front yard that a large ceramic frog sits on! Post some pics please? =^..^=
Posts.Title: O.M.G.!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: I said I wouldn't do it again...... he he If I'm totally nuts, you are totally bonkers. Yep. bonkers. Nuff said. =^..^=
Posts.Title: O.M.G.!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: too funny Tasha, I could just picture you jumping on a chair lifting your skirts and screaming. My hubby and I used to catch rattlers when we lived in the desert. Would give them to the snake wranglers to draw their venom to make anti-venom. We used to live in a little cabin with a 55 gallon drum full of them. They were the best alarm we ever had! ha ha. the only time I hated them is when I had to confront them with my cats. Thanks for the memories =^..^=
Posts.Title: O.M.G.!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Orphans, I love it, I can now tell my husband I adopted more plants instead of bought them. He doesn't really complain, just kind of rolls his eyes now. He has given up. Good. I have lots of yard, front and back, so I am always trying different things with it. Love playing in the dirt. Always was a tomboy. This just makes it legit. ha ha thanks for the shout out =^..^=
Posts.Title: O.M.G.!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Jeanie, I had a free flap done in August. That is the complete removal of the tummy skin and fat, and attached to the breast. There are quite a few here who have had something similar done, and we would be glad to answer questions. What exactly did you need to know? Cat
Posts.Title: Got New Breast from tummy

Posts.Content: In my younger hippie days, when we lived on a ranch, we caught them and gave them to the university to milk them of their venom. I also ate it once, thanks, but will never do that again. Had to try it! =^..^=
Posts.Title: O.M.G.!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Jan, I am almost two years out of chemo (September), and the fatigue comes and goes. I did work throughout, at the office, and in my yard (my favorite place to be). I was building brick retaining walls, using the pick to dig holes, etc. Just had to be careful because I am a huge klutz and am always hurting myself. The onc kept telling me to stop. Anyway, whatever works for you, do it. And don't measure yourself against others recovery time. You will get there. =^..^=
Posts.Title: How long does fatigue last??

Posts.Content: The eyes are easily affected by chemo. I used to wear contacts, but decided to not have anything foreign in my eyes during chemo. You would think your onc would tell you that one. But I did notice after chemo, my vision changed drastically and my eyes are now dry and the opthamologist recommended fish oil and a couple other things to keep the tears flowing. So it is probably the chemo, but better to be safe and talk to the onc about it. Cat
Posts.Title: Question about Eye

Posts.Content: I have not had reconstruction, but that does not sound right, and I think you should push your doctors to find out what is wrong. It may be nothing, but the unknown is always hard on you. Others may be able to give more info, but please get it checked and let us know. =^..^=
Posts.Title: Pain after reconstruction 3 years later

Posts.Content: must have been all those cold winter nights.... so happy birthday to all the August birthday babies, they include my niece and nephew too! Mine is November like Dee's, I figure those must have been a good Valentine's Day. Cat
Posts.Title: Time to Celebrate

Posts.Content: love the name. Seems as if a lot of us found this site after we had gone through treatment, I only found it this year, and I finished all major treatment the end of December 2007. Seems like anything you do will be a good celebration, sorry so late in welcoming you, but heartfelt all the same. Cat
Posts.Title: Time to Celebrate

Posts.Content: Jackie, I know very well what you mean. My sister (who works with me, so she saw every single thing I went through). from the beginning when I told her I was diagnosed. her response was "oh great and I have my mammo scheduled this week. Then she told me how someone was complaining about their life, and she said what about me? (her) my dad died, my mom had cancer, my sister has cancer...I just stood and stared with my mouth open. I never heard from my brother at all, the only time I spoke with him, was because my mom handed me the phone when he called her. He just kept telling me what not to eat so I don't get it again, I said thanks, but I never ate that stuff to begin with and here I am!" Go figure, I love my family to pieces, but sometimes..... They don't know how to deal with the strong one (that was me too) getting someting like this, and I think it throws them. All I can say is........hmm. nothing. sorry =^..^=
Posts.Title: I am so dissapointed in my family

Posts.Content: fellow Scorpio! =^..^=

Posts.Content: So glad you are feeling better from the surgery. There are so many things we could try telling you about chemo, but since everyone is different, and there are a number of different chemo types that might be prescribed, it is hard to say much. Just know that we will be here for you, and let us know when you get your chemo cocktail! Cat
Posts.Title: treatments starting soon

Posts.Content: 6 years is great! You give us newbies (2 years) proof that there is life after cancer. Hope you celebrated in style! =^..^=

Posts.Content: Yes it was a lot of fun, and slow typers are welcome too! you can scroll up and down if you get lost. And it is more fun that way too, you get a reply from something unexpected and that cracks everyone up. Patty try for the next time, just click, on it and way, you can go back and forth between the boards and chat. We should try to set up a meet more often. =^..^=
Posts.Title: Chat Room = Fast Typers! lol

Posts.Content: looks a lot like the cat I uploaded, just not creepy! you did it Jackie! yay Cat
Posts.Title: How do I show a picture

Posts.Content: I do know what you mean, I never wanted to be in pictures my grown life. But it was because I always hated seeing ME. I was always the little sister of the two beautiful other ones. Brother and Sister. But the weird part is that now I don't care. Take a pic of me, bald, fuzzy, etc. It doesn't matter anymore. Talking about fires, we had all of our old home movies put on a VHS tape, my brother had it for years to make copies, two weeks after I finally took it from him, his house burned down. That was a close one. Please do not NOT marry "sweet Reggie" because of the photo phobia. If it's right, do it! Then send us pics! HE HE Cat
Posts.Title: How do I show a picture

Posts.Content: PM me if you need more help!
Posts.Title: How do I show a picture

Posts.Content: Good luck with that Maureen! Hope you have lots of kitty litter! Cat

Posts.Title: How do I show a picture

Posts.Content: they re not chin hairs! they are stray eyebrow hairs! And mine did not grow until the hair came back, so....sorry? There is no justice when it comes to the weird hairs that pop out on us as we get older... Cat
Posts.Title: Eyelashes

Posts.Content: looks a lot like the cat I uploaded, just not creepy! you did it Jackie! yay Cat
Posts.Title: How do I show a picture

Posts.Content: I have missed this site and all the sisters here so much. it is hard for me to post, I read a few then the site freezes up on me. Been feeling a bit melancholy lately and had to come here and see how my friends are, and what is the first post I find?? You are wonderful! I am still having infection issues with my dear Frankenboobie/Picassoboobie, been ongoing since December and am getting very tired of being on antibiotics with all their wonderful side effects. Almost finished with round 3 double doses and don't think it's working. Oh well, we do keep smiling don't we? Glad to hear all the rest of our buddies chiming in, and I do remember Tasha posting that her "ex" got hold of her passwords etc and asked us to wait to hear from her under a different name, but it has been too long! Hope everyone has a good weekend! Cat
Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: Lost all hair everywhere, but my eyelashes were the most missed. You never realize how much debris they prevent from falling in your eyes! and yes, my face looked like one big blob. No definition. I don't wear makeup, and I did try a bit after that, but gave up. Just like the wigs, etc, I decided to go au natural (you know, that is how I met my husband 30 some odd years ago!). What was really weird, on a Friday going to work they were gone, Monday heading back to work they were back, just as if they were always there. Eyelashes and eyebrows. Very suddenly. You will miss them, but they do come back quick. And I even had the hair on my head growing back during the Taxol. give it a little time and things will be hairy again, and you will be saying: I really liked having no hair on my ____________. Take care! =^..^=
Posts.Title: Eyelashes

Posts.Content: call your doc! =^..^=
Posts.Title: back pain

Posts.Content: I have missed this site and all the sisters here so much. it is hard for me to post, I read a few then the site freezes up on me. I am still having infection issues with my dear Frankenboobie/Picassoboobie, been ongoing since December and am getting very tired of being on antibiotics with all their wonderful side effects. Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: issues, cancer related or not, can get annoying when they hang around too long. Hope you get everything resolved. You all lift my spirits whenever I visit here, and if you need to vent, you know we are here for you. I think my melancholy lately has been because it was President's Day weekend three years ago that I got my diagnosis. The actual date is Feb 19, but it was that holiday weekend that I hung around after having the needle biopsy, waiting for the news. But today is a better day (can smile for real, not just show teeth!), the infection seems to be letting go, and it is a beautiful warm sunny day. Maybe all I needed was the gift of all of you here. Smile like you mean it! Cat
Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: sounds like a plan and count me in! Cat
Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: shout out to Sherry. Good luck tomorrow! We will have you in our prayers, good vibes, etc for your surgery. Please keep us posted when you are able. Cat

Posts.Content: sounds like a plan and count me in! Cat

Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: Here's to all good answers coming to you both on Friday! =^..^=
Posts.Title: Biopsy on Friday

Posts.Content: You don't see many marriages lasting so long anymore. Congratulations and have a wonderful trip! =^..^=
Posts.Title: Our 35th anniversary

Posts.Content: Moopy! that is a great idea! we should find a spot in the middle of the country (or you could all come to my house!) and have a family reunion. so glad you got your shoes, I was very worried about a woman who didn't have shoes. I have shelves of them, even if they don't stay on long. I get to work at kick them under my desk, and there they stay til I leave again. My boss would occasionally hide them from me so I had to go on a scavenger hunt through the office to find them. You really need to buy more and soon. We wouldn't want Aortus to be upset right now, he has waaay too many godguppies to take care of! Have fun shopping! =^..^=
Posts.Title: Request for a VIRTUAL INTERVENTION with my wife Moopy

Posts.Content: Lisa, if crying is what gets you through the frustration, anger, happiness, worry, fright, etc. then, go ahead and let it out, reason or no. I never was good at crying, my eyes swelled up and looked like tomatoes (not a pretty sign). When I lost my dad, I would not cry, so on the way home from work, which seemed to be the time it hit me worst, I would scream. Feels good too! You do what you need to keep sane. Whatever you do, keep up the good fight. Cat
Posts.Title: "hormonal"crying

Posts.Content: another survivor on her way to her dance with NED. Glad you had a good, but long, day. Hope it goes as fast for you as it did for me. Cat
Posts.Title: First Day of Rads Today for T...

Posts.Content: missed it, but have seen it before, our CSN staff are really there for us aren't they? =^..^=
Posts.Title: Username32 Blocked

Posts.Content: but it does get a bit better. It will help when you get your treatment plan. Hope all goes well for you. Cat
Posts.Title: New to this

Posts.Content: Everyone here will tell you the waiting is the hardest part. Not knowing the next step and sitting in limbo. Never a good feeling, but do not feel foolish about worrying, this is something that anyone who hasn't been there, doesn't understand, you will get through this, it is scary, no other way to put it. Sounds like you have had more than your share of problems so far. We will all be here for you, just try to relax a bit (easier said than done I know). Take care and let us know how your appointment turns out tomorrow. Cat
Posts.Title: Seeing the surgeon again tomorrow

Posts.Content: Please do not apologize for sharing information! and you ARE missed when you don't post, you just miss those posts.....he he. The thread was about soy, but not about vitamin D. We seem to have a problem with D during and after our treatments, and the only reason I found out is I went to the RA doc because of some swelling in my hand, and he tested my D levels, which were about a 4. Very, very low. and I would want to know if my D's (not my boobs... anymore) had soy, so thank you for the info. =^..^=
Posts.Title: Soy and Vitamin D

Posts.Content: I had the PICC as my port did not work. If you would like to see a picture of it, it is on my expressions page. I would have preferred the port, it is under the skin and you dont have to worry about infection, cleaning, catching on things, etc. The PICC works well, but also needs to be gone from your body in under six months, at least that's what they told me. Good luck with either choice you make, it will always be the right one for you. When do you start your chemo? Cat
Posts.Title: Ladies I need Help

Posts.Content: The people who prey on others misfortune obviously have to live with themselves everyday, but we do not need to see or hear them. Hope all goes well Cindy. Cat
Posts.Title: Job Interview Questions

Posts.Content: so sorry about your emotional "lows". Hopefully, you will be back to your positive and confident self again soon. And if not, never hesitate to post, vent. It does a mind good! If you think you are a failure, you should know we all think you are one of the winners. And as we all go through the upheavals the body puts us through, it has to hit our psyche a bit too right? Your main goal to be healthy right now may have put others to the back for awhile, but that doesn't mean you have given up, just that you are waiting. Hope you are better this afternoon. Take care of yourself =^..^=
Posts.Title: I'm having a hard time...
